alert.note: Alert for New Kent; Northumberland; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 8:56PM EST until January 10 at 2:15AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central, eastern, and southeast Virginia, including the following counties, in east central Virginia, Essex, King William, King and Queen, New Kent, Richmond and Westmoreland. In eastern Virginia, Lancaster, Mathews, Middlesex and Northumberland. In southeast Virginia, Gloucester. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 856 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... King William, Mathews, Gloucester Courthouse, West Point, Tappahannock, Warsaw, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Montross, Robley, King And Queen Court House, Callao, Deltaville, Fair Port, Saint Stephens Church, Gloucester Point, Lancaster, White Stone, Jamaica and Church View. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
